lines.title: Airport Branch
lines.summary: The Airport Branch (also known as the Stepford Airport Branch ) is a branch served by Stepford Connect , Waterline and AirLink services, all AirLink routes go on this branch. Airport West station is not a part of this branch.
lines.content_text: Airport Branch Operators Termini Stepford Airport Parkway Stepford Airport Central Airport Terminal 2 Airport Terminal 3 Number of Stations 5 Speed Limits 15-110 MPH Depots/Sidings Stepford Airport Parkway Siding Stepford Airport Parkway TMD Farleigh TMD Electrification Yes Signal Zone C D ( Stepford Airport Parkway TMD ) Line Map to Morganstown to Stepford Main Line Stepford Airport Parkway TMD Signal Zone D Signal Zone C Stepford Airport Parkway Siding to Stepford Main Line Stepford Airport Parkway Stepford Airport Central Airport Terminal 1 Airport Terminal 3 to Esterfield Airport Terminal 2 Farleigh TMD (Road 17) Farleigh TMD (Road 11) The Airport Branch (also known as the Stepford Airport Branch ) is a branch served by Stepford Connect , Waterline and AirLink services, all AirLink routes go on this branch. Airport West station is not a part of this branch. The Airport Branch has long existed even before The Big Update . At the time, the branch only consisted of Stepford Airport Parkway and Stepford Airport Central . With the release of Version 1.1 , a new operator, AirLink , was founded. This operator extends the branch to Airport Terminal 1 and Airport Terminal 2 . At the same time, Stepford Airport Parkway Siding and Stepford Airport Parkway TMD was also built exclusively for AirLink trains. On 2 February 2019, the branch was further extended with the opening of Airport Terminal 3 . This became the final extension of the branch to this day. In V1.10 , Waterline was extended from Airport West to Airport Terminal 2 , using part of the branch. In the aforementioned update, Stepford Connect had some routes extended to Airport Terminal 2 via Stepford Airport Central. lines.title: Barton Branch
lines.summary: The Barton Branch is a loop branch line in Stepford County Railway . It branches off after Bodin and merges with the Morganstown Branch between Elsemere Junction and Berrily going towards Elsemere Junction. It was released in Version 2.2 and is operated & managed only by Metro .
lines.content_text: Barton Branch Operators Termini Barton Number of Stations 2 Speed Limits 30-45 MPH Depots/Sidings None Electrification Yes Signal Zone B Line Map to Bodin Coxly Newtown Barton to Elsemere Junction The Barton Branch is a loop branch line in Stepford County Railway . It branches off after Bodin and merges with the Morganstown Branch between Elsemere Junction and Berrily going towards Elsemere Junction. It was released in Version 2.2 and is operated & managed only by Metro . This forms the Barton Loop, connecting the Stepford Main Line and the Morganstown Branch . When terminating at Barton, trains simply continue straight around the loop if they do not change routes. Stations [ ] Coxly Newtown Barton Routes [ ] Operator Route Origin Destination Notes R132 Stepford Central Barton Clockwise ↻ (towards Elsemere ) R133 Willowfield R134 St Helens Bridge R135 Beechley Anti-clockwise ↺ (towards Bodin ) R136 Stepford Victoria Trivia [ ] Interestingly, after exiting Barton , there is a second tunnel turning left towards Berrily , hinting at a possible expansion of the branch. It might lead to Greenslade , as there are unused tracks that lead to an abandoned tunnel, which aligns with the second tunnel [ citation needed ] . The community speculates that in Version 2.3 , the tunnel stub from Barton may be used. This is due to Metro serving Whitney Green as shown in a Sneak Peek posted on 5 November 2025. lines.title: Connolly Branch
lines.summary: The Connolly Branch is a branch served by Waterline services to Newry Harbour , Newry and Benton . The branch was added in Version 1.0 .
lines.content_text: Connolly Branch Operators Termini Connolly Number of Stations 3 Speed Limits 15-75 MPH Depots/Sidings None Electrification Yes Signal Zone F Line Map 1.92 mi Connolly 0.93 mi Ashlan Park to Esterfield 0.37 mi Cambridge Street Parkway to Stepford Main Line The Connolly Branch is a branch served by Waterline services to Newry Harbour , Newry and Benton . The branch was added in Version 1.0 . It splits from the Esterfield Branch between Cambridge Street Parkway and Ashlan Park . In Version 1.9 , the line has seen the addition of overhead line equipment (OHLE) masts and catenaries, though no wires were installed until Version 2.0 . lines.title: Esterfield Branch
lines.summary: The Esterfield Branch , or formerly the James Street Branch , is a branch served by Waterline .
lines.content_text: Esterfield Branch Operators Termini Farleigh Esterfield Number of Stations 6 Speed Limits 15-100 MPH Depots/Sidings Esterfield TMD Farleigh TMD Electrification Yes Signal Zone C ( Airport West only) F ( Cambridge Street Parkway only) G ( James Street <> Esterfield ) Line Map to Stepford Main Line Cambridge Street Parkway to Connolly Signal Zone F Signal Zone C 0.94 mi Airport West to Airport Signal Zone C Signal Zone G Farleigh TMD (Road 2) 2.37 mi James Street 2.74 mi Farleigh 3.73 mi Rosedale Village Esterfield TMD 4.81 mi Esterfield The Esterfield Branch , or formerly the James Street Branch , is a branch served by Waterline . This branch was extended from James Street to Esterfield in Version 1.10 . According to the SCR Directors, this extension would be the very last extension for the SCR Network for the foreseeable future, due to their aims at switching their development focus back to aspects like improving the current gameplay experience and performance soon. However, this would be disproven by the opening of the Rayleigh Bay Branch in Version 2.0 . Contents 1 Stations 2 Depots & Sidings 3 Routes 4 History 5 Sneak peeks 5.1 Speculated sneak peek 5.2 Sneak peeks for Version 1.10 5.2.1 Sneak peek on 12 June 2022 5.2.2 Sneak peek on 24 July 2022 5.2.3 Sneak peek on 7 August 2022 5.2.4 Update trailer on 27 August 2022 6 Trivia Stations [ ] * Limited service station Cambridge Street Parkway Airport West James Street * Farleigh Rosedale Village * Esterfield Depots & Sidings [ ] Farleigh Train Maintenance Depot James Street Siding (not in use) Esterfield Train Maintenance Depot Routes [ ] Operator Route Origin Destination Notes R011 Newry Connolly Stops at Cambridge Street Parkway only R012 Newry Harbour R014 Newry Esterfield Skips James Street and Rosedale Village R016 Benton R017 Newry Airport Terminal 2 Stops at Cambridge Street Parkway and Airport West only R018 Newry Harbour Farleigh R019 Benton Connolly Stops at Cambridge Street Parkway only History [ ] 2018 31 December - Version 1.1 James Street Branch opened with three stations: Cambridge Street Parkway , Airport West , and James Street . 2021 22 January A poll was released by Charlie_RBX on the official SCR Discord Server asking whether to build the Waterline James Street extension or the Stepford Connect extension between Leighton Stepford Road and Llyn-by-the-Sea . Results (as of 31 May 2021): 2096 votes for Leighton West extension, 5575 votes for Waterline extension. 22 August Sneak peek for Leighton West released, leading to speculation that the Waterline extension was cancelled. 23 October During a Developer Q&A, it was confirmed that both the Leighton West and Waterline extensions would be built. Leighton West included in Version 1.8 . Waterline extension would follow as part of a future Airport Zone overhaul. 2022 7 August Sneak peek of Farleigh released, sparking speculation about multiple stations in the upcoming extension. This was later confirmed via a video on BanTech's YouTube channel. 27 August - Version 1.10 Waterline extension released as part of a major Airport Zone upgrade. Branch renamed from James Street Branch to Esterfield Branch . Three new stations added: Farleigh , Rosedale Village , and Esterfield . Sneak peeks [ ] Speculated sneak peek [ ] The sneak peek in question On 18 April 2022, a sneak peek was released of an unknown Waterline station. Many players suspected that the station shown is the station past James Street , as it appeared to be in an area not seen before in SCR. However this was seen as impossible, as the station shown is not a terminating station. Some players have assumed that it was a refreshed James Street , while others thought that it was an upgraded Ashlan Park . However, when V1.9 was released, the sneak peek turned out to show Eden Quay . Sneak peeks for Version 1.10 [ ] Before the release of V1.10 , a few sneak peeks were speculated to show the extension. Sneak peek on 12 June 2022 [ ] The sneak peek of Airport West On 12 June 2022, SCR released a sneak peek of an unknown Waterline station. Many people presume that this station is Airport West or James Street . A week later, a sneak peek of Airport Terminal 1 was released. These sneak peeks, along with the statement given in the Q&A on 23 October 2021, has led to speculations that the Waterline extension may come in the near future. The station ultimately turned out to be Airport West . Sneak peek on 24 July 2022 [ ] Sneak peek of the then-unknown Esterfield , the terminus of the extension. On 24 July 2022, another sneak peek was released featuring another unknown Waterline station. The caption - "Bringing you the worst, best kept secret in the whole of Stepford county..." - made players speculate that this is the terminus of the extension, as it has been delayed multiple times and has been a mark throughout SCR's history. The station eventually became known as Esterfield . Sneak peek on 7 August 2022 [ ] The sneak peek of Farleigh station On 7 August 2022, a sneak peek of the new Farleigh station on Waterline was revealed, many players speculated this station along with the sneak peek above will be part of the Waterline Extension, and that the extension will include two or more stations instead of one. Update trailer on 27 August 2022 [ ] On 27 August, a video released on BanTech's YouTube channel showcased Version 1.10 . In one frame of the video, a Waterline PIS is seen displaying "t, Farleigh , Rose...", and with the train's destination being " Esterfield ", hinting that there are at least three stations beyond James Street , if the 'T' is for James Stree t . This theory was confirmed with the release of the update on the same day. Trivia [ ] The extension was originally planned to have multiple stations past James Street , before being cut down to just one station due to the size of the Willowfield extension. However, the sneak peeks of Esterfield and Farleigh , published on 24 July 2022 and 7 August 2022 respectively, prompted speculations in the community that the extension would once again have more than one station. These speculations were eventually confirmed with the release of V1.10 on 27 August 2022. lines.title: Greenslade Branch
lines.summary: The Greenslade Branch is a branch line that branches off the Stepford Main Line after Benton . It is served by Stepford Connect , Metro and Waterline services, with Stepford Express services passing through the branch. The branch also includes the last remains of the proposed Tramlink network. lines.title: Leighton West Branch
lines.summary: The Leighton West Branch is a small branch located between Leighton City and Edgemead ; the only station on this branch is Leighton West . The branch was added in Version 1.8 .
lines.content_text: Leighton West Branch Operators Termini Leighton West Number of Stations 1 Speed Limits 15-45 MPH Depots/Sidings None Electrification Yes Signal Zone D Line Map 0.78 mi Leighton West to Stepford Main Line The Leighton West Branch is a small branch located between Leighton City and Edgemead ; the only station on this branch is Leighton West . The branch was added in Version 1.8 . This is the shortest branch in SCR , with only one station. lines.title: Metro Core Section
lines.summary: The Metro Core Section is an underground part of the network used exclusively by Metro services. It diverges into two separate tunnels after City Hospital , running between Stepford Central and Stepford High Street , and joins up the Stepford Main Line before St Helens Bridge ; or the Whitefield Branch before Whitefield Lido . This was opened in Version 2.2 .
lines.content_text: Metro Core Section Operators Termini Stepford Central Number of Stations 4 Speed Limits 30-50 MPH Depots/Sidings Stepford Depot Electrification Yes Signal Zone J ( Stepford Central to Stepford High Street ) The Metro Core Section is an underground part of the network used exclusively by Metro services. It diverges into two separate tunnels after City Hospital , running between Stepford Central and Stepford High Street , and joins up the Stepford Main Line before St Helens Bridge ; or the Whitefield Branch before Whitefield Lido . This was opened in Version 2.2 . All Metro routes, except R028 , R029 , R047 , R131 and R134 , use the Metro Core Section. lines.title: Metro Loop
lines.content_text: This page is about the line in the original Metro plans. For the current Metro line forming a loop, see Barton Branch . Cancelled feature This article or section covers content that was once proposed, but was ultimately not released to the main game. These are considered cancelled features. Cancelled feature This article or section covers content that was once proposed, but was ultimately not released to the main game. These are considered cancelled features. The Metro Loop , also known as the Stepford Loop , was an intended loop branch that was supposed to be operated by Metro . It was supposed to go from the original Beechley (now City Hospital ) to St Helens Park . However, due to the original cancellation of Metro , it was demolished and the only existing part of it is the current Stepford Victoria Branch . Return speculation [ ] Speculated feature This article or section covers content, which is believed to be added to the game, but has not been officially confirmed by the developers. These are speculated features, and the information may be inaccurate. Speculated feature This article or section covers content, which is believed to be added to the game, but has not been officially confirmed by the developers. These are speculated features, and the information may be inaccurate. With Metro 's return in Version 2.2 , many players speculated that the original Metro Loop could return along with the previously proposed stations. However, the Metro Loop did not return and a new loop including Coxly Newtown was added instead. It is unknown if an introduction of the Metro Loop is planned in the future. On 29 October 2025, a sneak peek for Version 2.3 was released, showcasing an unknown Metro-branded station, supposedly located in Stepford City . Some users theorise this station might be related to the Metro Loop or be part of a newer take on it. Stations [ ] Beechley ( City Hospital ) Willowfield ( Financial Quarter ) Stepford Victoria University Stepford Southgate St Helens South Old Harrow A map of the Metro Loop - touch to see closer. Additionally, St Helens Bridge , Stepford East and Stepford Town ( Stepford Central ) were associated with the loop, though not directly part of it. lines.title: Morganstown Branch
lines.summary: The Morganstown Branch is a branch line in Stepford County Railway that branches off the Stepford Main Line at St Helens Bridge and runs to Morganstown . Despite the name, Morganstown Docks is not a part of this branch. This branch opened on 31 December 2018 .
lines.content_text: Morganstown Branch Operators Number of Stations 7 Speed Limits 15-125 MPH Depots/Sidings Berrily Depot Morganstown Siding Electrification Yes Signal Zone B ( New Harrow to Beaulieu Park ) D ( Morganstown ) Line Map to Stepford Main Line New Harrow Elsemere Pond Elsemere Junction Berrily Berrily TMD East Berrily Beaulieu Park to Greenslade Signal Zone F | Signal Zone B Signal Zone D River Ben Morganstown Morganstown Siding to Airport to Stepford Main Line The Morganstown Branch is a branch line in Stepford County Railway that branches off the Stepford Main Line at St Helens Bridge and runs to Morganstown . Despite the name, Morganstown Docks is not a part of this branch. This branch opened on 31 December 2018 . Contents 1 Stations 2 Depots & Sidings 3 Routes 4 History 5 Infrastructure Stations [ ] New Harrow Elsemere Pond Elsemere Junction Berrily East Berrily Beaulieu Park Morganstown Depots & Sidings [ ] Berrily TMD Morganstown Siding Routes [ ] Operator Route Origin Destination Notes R007 Stepford Central Morganstown Skips New Harrow , Elsemere Pond , East Berrily and Beaulieu Park R008 Stepford Victoria Berrily R015 Benton Morganstown Branded as Morganstown Shuttle. Can only be driven by diesel trains with 2 coaches R027 Stepford Central Berrily R030 Willowfield R034 Beechley Morganstown R051 Stepford Central Stepford Airport Central Fast service R052 Airport Terminal 2 R053 Stopper service calling at Elsemere Junction and Morganstown R054 Stepford Airport Central Stopper service calling at Berrily Airport-bound only R055 Airport Terminal 3 Services do not stop on this branch R058 Stopper service calling at Morganstown only R059 Airport Terminal 2 Stopper service calling at Elsemere Junction only R080 Stepford Central Llyn-by-the-Sea Fast service via Morganstown R081 Super fast service R082 Westwyvern R083 Newry Llyn-by-the-Sea R084 Newry Harbour Skips Morganstown R085 Benton R086 Newry Leighton City Skips Morganstown R120 Newry Harbour Morganstown Can only be driven by diesel trains with 2 coaches R130 Stepford Central R131 St Helens Bridge R132 Stepford Central Barton Westbound only R133 Willowfield R134 St Helens Bridge R135 Beechley Eastbound only R136 Stepford Victoria R137 Morganstown Via Benton History [ ] 2018 31 December - Version 1.1 Morganstown Branch opened. Connect and AirLink services began operating on the branch. 2020 22 June - Version 1.6 Waterline introduced a shuttle service between Benton and Morganstown . Morganstown Siding constructed exclusively for the shuttle. 29 October - Version 1.7 Stepford Express began running services via the Morganstown Branch. Morganstown became the only station served by all four operators at the time. 2024 12 August - Version 2.0 Waterline introduced a second route to Morganstown, connecting it with Newry Harbour . 2025 11 May - Version 2.2 Metro began operating services on the Morganstown Branch. Metro took over management of all stations on the branch previously managed by Stepford Connect . lines.title: Newry Branch
lines.summary: The Newry Branch is a branch of the Stepford Main Line , served by Waterline and Stepford Express . The entire branch was overhauled in Version 1.9 , with West Benton station upgraded later in Version 1.9.1. The line between Newry Harbour and Newry does not have any electrification and can only be accessed by diesel or bi-mode trains.
lines.content_text: Newry Branch Operators Termini Newry Harbour Newry Number of Stations 5 Speed Limits 15-100 MPH Depots/Sidings Newry Siding Faraday Road TMD Electrification Yes ( Newry - West Benton ) No ( Newry Harbour - Newry ) Signal Zone F Line Map 3.20 mi Newry Harbour 2.72 mi Newry 2.45 mi Newry Siding 1.83 mi Eden Quay 1.02 mi Faraday Road 0.82 mi Faraday Road TMD 0.49 mi West Benton to Stepford Main Line The Newry Branch is a branch of the Stepford Main Line , served by Waterline and Stepford Express . The entire branch was overhauled in Version 1.9 , with West Benton station upgraded later in Version 1.9.1. The line between Newry Harbour and Newry does not have any electrification and can only be accessed by diesel or bi-mode trains. Contents 1 Stations 2 Depots & Sidings 3 Routes 4 Trivia Stations [ ] * Limited service station Newry Harbour * Newry Eden Quay Faraday Road West Benton Depots & Sidings [ ] Newry Siding Faraday Road Train Maintenance Depot Routes [ ] Operator Route Origin Destination R010 Newry Greenslade R011 Connolly R012 Newry Harbour R014 Newry Esterfield R017 Airport Terminal 2 R018 Newry Harbour Farleigh R083 Newry Llyn-by-the-Sea R084 Newry Harbour R086 Newry Leighton City R120 Newry Harbour Morganstown Trivia [ ] The line is diesel-only and has no electrification between Newry and Newry Harbour . However, until the introduction of restrictions for electric trains in V2.0 , electric trains could still run to the station. In addition, due to the lack of electrification at the Morganstown Flyover , the Class 390 , Class 397 and Class 801 cannot access the Newry branch as a whole. lines.title: Rayleigh Bay Branch
lines.summary: The Rayleigh Bay Branch is a branch line in Stepford County Railway that branches off the Stepford Main Line at Edgemead and is operated by Stepford Connect and Stepford Express . It was added in Version 2.0 , and has 3 stations. The branch does not have electrification and can only be accessed by diesel and bi-mode trains. (eg. Class 800 )
lines.content_text: Rayleigh Bay Branch Operators Termini Rayleigh Bay Number of Stations 3 Speed Limits 15-60 MPH Depots/Sidings None Electrification No Signal Zone H Line Map To Stepford Main Line Signal Zone E Signal Zone H Aslockby Carnalea Bridge Sidings Carnalea Bridge Rayleigh Bay The Rayleigh Bay Branch is a branch line in Stepford County Railway that branches off the Stepford Main Line at Edgemead and is operated by Stepford Connect and Stepford Express . It was added in Version 2.0 , and has 3 stations. The branch does not have electrification and can only be accessed by diesel and bi-mode trains. (eg. Class 800 ) Contents 1 Stations 2 Depots & Sidings 3 Stock 4 Routes 5 Trivia Stations [ ] Aslockby Carnalea Bridge Rayleigh Bay Depots & Sidings [ ] Carnalea Bridge Sidings (not in use) Stock [ ] Due to the lack of electrification, only diesel and bi-mode trains can access this branch. For Stepford Connect , only the Class 68 , Class 156 , Class 158 , Class 168 , Class 170 , Class 185 and Class 195/2 can access this branch. For Stepford Express , only the Class 43 , Class 180 , Class 220 , Class 221 and Class 800 can access this branch. Routes [ ] Operator Route Origin Destination Notes R049 Rayleigh Bay Edgemead R050 Llyn-by-the-Sea R087 Skips Aslockby and Carnalea Bridge R100 Leighton West R101 Leighton City R102 Westwyvern Exclusive to Class 156 Trivia [ ] This branch is the only branch to use semaphore signals . This branch is one of the only branches in the network to not have OHLE, and therefore can only be driven on by diesel trains. The signals for this branch all start with the letter "R". There are no limited service stops on this branch. This branch, along with the Leighton West Branch and the Airport Branch , are the only branches to contain single-platform stations. The branch merges into a single track near Carnalea Bridge . To enter the branch from the Stepford Main Line , services must travel via Platform 1 at Edgemead . Stepford Connect trains headed between Leighton City / Leighton West and the branch will need to switch directions there. This branch and the Leighton West Branch are the only two branches that have no connection to Stepford City. This was once the only branch on Stepford Connect that required a train to be purchased first, because the starter train, the Class 357 , cannot be driven on this branch. The minimum number of points needed to drive on this branch is 1,800 points . However, with the removal of electrification on the Whitefield Branch in Version 2.2 , it is no longer unique to this branch Example: Purchase the Class 158 (1,500 points ) and R050 (300 points ). It is possible to walk along the whole branch from Aslockby to Rayleigh Bay . Lines Willowfield Branch • Stepford Victoria Branch • Metro Loop • Stepford Main Line • Metro Core Section • Whitefield Branch • Barton Branch • Morganstown Branch • Newry Branch • Connolly Branch • Esterfield Branch • Greenslade Branch • Airport Branch • Leighton West Branch • Rayleigh Bay Branch Upcoming lines are marked in italics . lines.title: Stepford Main Line
lines.summary: The Stepford Main Line is the most important rail line in Stepford County. It is used by all operators, although Waterline only uses a small fraction of the Main Line, specifically around Benton . The line runs between Stepford Central and Llyn-by-the-Sea , running via Benton . The line has a total length of 22.7 miles (36.5 kilometres).

The line runs between Stepford Central and Llyn-by-the-Sea , running via Benton . The line has a total length of 22.7 miles (36.5 kilometres). Hist [ ] 2017 25 November Stepford Main Line opened between Stepford Town and Winstree . Services operated exclusively by Connect . 4 December WaterLine , a sub-franchise of Connect , began services on the Greenslade Branch between Benton and Greenslade , using part of the Main Line. 20 December Services began on the Newry Branch . 2018 21 April - The Big Update Winstree replaced by Leighton Stepford Road . New stations opened: Rocket Parade and Leighton City . Stepford Town renamed to Stepford Central . 31 December - Version 1.1 AirLink commenced services between Stepford Central and Stepford Airport Central , using the Main Line up to St Helens Bridge . Main Line extended to Edgemead . Stepford Victoria Branch opened west of the Main Line. 2019 28 April - Version 1.2 Whitefield Branch opened, splitting from the Main Line at Stepford East . 17 September - Five Million Update AirLink began services between the Airport Zone and Leighton Stepford Road . 17 December - Version 1.4 Main Line extended from Edgemead to Llyn-by-the-Sea , adding 8 new stations. Express launched, running the full Main Line between Stepford Central and Llyn-by-the-Sea . 2020 29 October - Version 1.7 Upper Staploe station opened on the Main Line. Abandoned Upper Staploe (Metro) station remains unused. Overhauls to Bodin , Benton , Benton Bridge (Station) , Hampton Hargate , and Water Newton . Stepford Express began using the Morganstown Branch . 2021 5 December - Version 1.8 Overhauls to: Rocket Parade , Leighton Stepford Road , Leighton City , and Millcastle Racecourse . Leighton West Branch opened between Leighton City and Edgemead , adding Leighton West . 2022 15 May - Version 1.9 Stepford Express began serving the Newry Branch , adding direct services to Newry Harbour , Newry , and Eden Quay from the Main Line. 2024 12 August - Version 2.0 Rayleigh Bay Branch opened, splitting off from the Main Line at Edgemead . Upgrades to Main Line stations: Stepford Central , Upper Staploe (Metro) , Water Newton , Leighton Stepford Road , Edgemead , Faymere , Millcastle , Westwyvern , and Northshore . 2025 11 May - Version 2.2 Metro began operations on the Main Line from St Helens Bridge to Benton . lines.title: Stepford Victoria Branch
lines.summary: The Stepford Victoria Branch is a branch located below the Willowfield Branch on the Network Map . It opened on 31 December 2018 .
lines.content_text: Stepford Victoria Branch Operators Termini Stepford Victoria Number of Stations 3 Speed Limits 15-60 MPH Depots/Sidings None Electrification Yes Signal Zone A Line Map to Stepford Main Line City Hospital to Willowfield Financial Quarter Stepford Victoria The Stepford Victoria Branch is a branch located below the Willowfield Branch on the Network Map . It opened on 31 December 2018 . The branch is an extent out of the Stepford Main Line . Contents 1 Stations 2 Depots & Sidings 3 Routes 4 History 5 Infrastructure Stations [ ] Stepford Victoria Financial Quarter City Hospital Depots & Sidings [ ] There are no depots or sidings on this branch. Routes [ ] Operator Route Origin Destination Notes R005 Stepford Victoria Stepford Airport Central Skips City Hospital R006 Port Benton R008 Berrily R009 Edgemead Skips Financial Quarter and City Hospital R023 Stepford UFC R026 Llyn-by-the-Sea Skips Financial Quarter and City Hospital R028 Willowfield R029 Beechley R045 Leighton City Skips Financial Quarter and City Hospital R046 Airport Terminal 2 Skips Financial Quarter R136 Barton R137 Morganstown History [ ] 2018 21 April - The Big Update Original plans to include the Stepford Victoria Branch in the Metro Loop were scrapped. 31 December - Version 1.1 Stepford Victoria Branch opened under Connect . New stations: City Hospital , Financial Quarter , and Stepford Victoria . Financial Quarter and Stepford Victoria were 2 of 17 proposed Metro stations that opened under Stepford Connect after Metro's cancellation. 2020 22 June - Version 1.6 Willowfield Branch opened. Trains west of Stepford Central could now terminate at Stepford Victoria , Beechley , or Willowfield . 2024 12 August - Version 2.0 Stepford Victoria Branch was electrified. Infrastructure [ ] Signals Speed Limits Starts from Stepford Victoria station, Beechley Triangle signals only include the ones between Financial Quarter and City Hospital . lines.title: Whitefield Branch
lines.summary: The Whitefield Branch is a branch line that branches off the Stepford Main Line at Stepford East .
lines.content_text: Whitefield Branch Operators Termini Stepford UFC Whitefield Number of Stations 5 Speed Limits 15-100 MPH Depots/Sidings Woodhead Lane SB Depot Woodhead Lane NB Depot Whitefield Siding Electrification Yes (Metro Core Section - Woodhead Lane TMD) No (Abandonded Stepford High Street platform, Woodhead Lane TMD - Whitefield) Signal Zone A Line Map Whitefield Whitefield Siding Houghton Rake Woodhead Lane Woodhead Lane TMD Stepford United Football Club Whitefield Lido Stepford High Street to Stepford Main Line The Whitefield Branch is a branch line that branches off the Stepford Main Line at Stepford East . The branch was first proposed under Metro operations with 6 stations ( Stepford High Street , Whitefield Lido , Stepford United FC (now Stepford United Football Club , Stepford UFC, or Stepford United), Woodhead Lane , Houghton Rake and Whitefield ) without any connections to other operators . The project of Metro (in its original iteration) was soon left abandoned. It opened on 28 April 2019 . Contents 1 Stations 1.1 Former 2 Depots & Sidings 2.1 Former 3 Routes 4 History 5 Infrastructure 6 Trivia 7 References Stations [ ] * Limited service station Whitefield Lido Stepford United Football Club Woodhead Lane Houghton Rake * Whitefield Former [ ] Stepford High Street Depots & Sidings [ ] Woodhead Lane Train Maintenance Depot Whitefield Siding Former [ ] Whitefield Lido Siding Routes [ ] Operator Route Origin Destination Notes R020 Stepford Central Whitefield Diesel only R021 Stepford United Football Club R022 Beechley Whitefield Skips Houghton Rake , diesel only R023 Stepford Victoria Stepford United Football Club R031 Willowfield R103 Whitefield Diesel only History [ ] 2019 28 April - Version 1.2 Stepford Connect (then known as Connect) began operating services on the branch to and from Stepford. Trains originated or terminated at either Stepford UFC or Whitefield . 2021 5 December - Version 1.8 Entire branch overhauled (except Stepford High Street ) by former developer Mattyx2013 . A small Easter egg referencing his work was added near Whitefield station. 2025 11 May - Version 2.2 Stepford High Street moved underground into the Metro Core Section , with its former elevated platforms now abandoned. Electrification removed between Woodhead Lane TMD and Whitefield , restricting the line to diesel-only Stepford Connect trains. Infrastructure [ ] Signals Speed Limits Missing information This article is a stub , which contains incomplete information that may not be accurate. You can help the SCR Wiki by adding more information. Missing information This article is a stub , which contains incomplete information that may not be accurate. You can help the SCR Wiki by adding more information. Location Speed Limit (MPH) Facing Entering the tunnel from Stepford East towards Stepford High Street 100 → 45 Facing Whitefield After Stepford High Street Platform 1 45 → 80 Facing Whitefield Before entering Stepford High Street Platform 2 80 → 45 Facing Stepford East Entering Stepford United Football Club 80 → 45 Facing Whitefield 100 → 45 Facing Stepford East Leaving Stepford United Football Club Platform 3 45 → 100 Facing Whitefield Exiting Woodhead Lane TMD 30 → 100 Facing Stepford East Facing Whitefield Leaving Whitefield 45 → 100 Facing Stepford East Entering Whitefield 100 → 45 Facing Whitefield Leaving Whitefield (From Whitefield Siding ) 30 → 100 Facing Stepford East Trivia [ ] According to Mattyx2013 , this branch was originally supposed to have third rail [ 1 ] . Strangely, the developers decided to replace the third rail with Overhead Line Equipment for unknown reasons despite some trains (such as the Class 444 , Class 458 and Class 707 ) only being able to be powered by third rail in real life. The OHLE is now only used by Metro, as the line beyond Stepford UFC is explicitly unelectrified and limited to diesels. OHLE was removed after Woodhead Lane TMD and on the abandoned Stepford High Street platforms with Version 2.2 . References [ ] ↑ Actual SCR Secrets (I Promise!) (29 September 2022). Mattyx2013 on YouTube. Retrieved 14 October 2022. lines.title: Willowfield Branch
lines.summary: The Willowfield Branch is a railway branch located above the Stepford Victoria Branch and to the left of the Whitefield Branch on the Network Map . It opened on 22 June 2020 .
lines.content_text: Willowfield Branch Operators Termini Willowfield Beechley Number of Stations 4 Speed Limits 15-90 MPH Depots/Sidings Willowfield Station Depot Willowfield Mainline Depot Beechley Sidings Electrification Yes Signal Zone A Line Map Willowfield Willowfield Depot Hemdon Park Beechley Beechley Sidings to Stepford Victoria City Hospital to Stepford Main Line The Willowfield Branch is a railway branch located above the Stepford Victoria Branch and to the left of the Whitefield Branch on the Network Map . It opened on 22 June 2020 . As of 11 May 2025 , Metro owns and operates all stations on the branch, including City Hospital . Following this change, Stepford Connect services no longer stop at Hemdon Park and have limited services at City Hospital .
